com.avaya.csta.tonedetection

Interface ToneDetectionServices


  • public interface ToneDetectionServices
    Used to detect and report individual DTMF tones (in-band and out-of-band) that are received by a device. In-band tones are transmitted within the media stream. Out-of-band tones are transmitted through the signaling channel. The tone detection mode is determined at connector server startup from the cmapi-user-configuration.properties file. The property called com.avaya.mvcs.media.ToneDetectionServices.ttd_mode can be set to IN_BAND or OUT_BAND. To detect only out-of-band tones, set the mode to OUT_BAND. To detect both in-band and out-of-band tones, set the mode to IN_BAND. The default value is OUT_BAND.

    In-band tone detection service is not available for media encoded with G.729 and G.729A.

    Multiple listeners can be added on a device.

    Each digit that is detected is reported via the ToneDetectedEvent.

    Prerequisites Before attempting to use ToneDetectionServices, do the following:

    1. Obtain a ToneDetectionServices object by using ServiceProvider.
      2.         ToneDetectionServices toneDetectionServices =
        (ToneDetectionServices)servProv.getService
        (com.avaya.csta.tonedetection.ToneDetectionServices.class.getName());
    2. Get a device ID from DeviceServices and gain exclusive control of the device using TerminalServices.
    3. Implement a ToneDetectionListener to specify what to do in case of DTMF digit activity. Add the listener using the addToneDetectionListener method.

    Clean Up After you are finished using this service, do the following:

    1. Remove any listeners you added using the toneDetectionServices.removeToneDetectionListener method.
    Since:
    Communication Manager API 2.1
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.4 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • addToneDetectionListener

        void addToneDetectionListener(DeviceID device,
                              ToneDetectionListener listener)
                       throws CstaException
        Deprecated. Use MonitoringServices.addToneDetectionListener instead.
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified device for tone detection events.

        Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

        When an event occurs, the corresponding listener callback is called. A default callback is provided by ToneDetectionAdapter for each possible event. The default callbacks do nothing. If you want to act upon events, you can customize the events' callbacks for your application in either of the following ways:

        • Provide an implementation of every callback method in the ToneDetectionListener interface with a class that implements ToneDetectionListener.
        • Provide an implementation of a subset of callback methods with a class that extends ToneDetectionAdapter.

        If multiple listeners are added to a device, then each listener will be notified of events on that device; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to which the ToneDetectionListener is added.
        listener - the listener being applied to the device. The listener may be an implementation of the ToneDetectionListener interface or an extension of ToneDetectionAdapter.
        Throws:
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
        InvalidParameterValueException - if device ID or listener is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeToneDetectionListener

        void removeToneDetectionListener(DeviceID device,
                                 ToneDetectionListener listener)
                          throws CstaException
        Deprecated. Use MonitoringServices.removeToneDetectionListener instead.
        Removes a previously specified tone detection listener. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added or no listener is on the device, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed.
        Parameters:
        device - the device whose ToneDetectionListener is to be removed
        listener - the listener being removed from the device.
        Throws:
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
        InvalidParameterValueException - if device ID is null or listener is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
